derivation.yuyuan_name: early 18th cent.: from Latin dictatorius (from dictator: see dictator) + -al

entry.def: Dictatorial means controlled or used by a dictator.

example.ex: He suspended the constitution and assumed dictatorial powers.
example.tran: 他搁置宪法，实行独裁统治。

entry.tran: 专横的;霸道的;喜欢发号施令的
entry.def: If you describe someone's behaviour as dictatorial, you do not like the fact that they tell people what to do in a forceful and unfair way.

example.ex: If you are too strict with them, your children will see you as dictatorial.
example.tran: 如果对孩子要求太严，他们会觉得你独断专行。
他专横霸道的管理风格

means.word_mean: 1. of or characteristic of a dictator;
2. likened to a dictator in severity
4. characteristic of an absolute ruler or absolute rule; having absolute sovereignty;

sentences.sentence: "a dictatorial rule that lasted for the duration of the war"

auth_sentence.content: They've made war a matter of dictatorial power.
auth_sentence.res_content: They've made war a matter of dictatorial power.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: They've made war a matter of dictatorial power.

auth_sentence.content: He rose...to almost dictatorial authority in the State.
auth_sentence.res_content: He rose...to almost dictatorial authority in the State.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He rose...to almost dictatorial authority in the State.

auth_sentence.content: In his second term, Mr. Thaksin became increasingly dictatorial.
auth_sentence.res_content: In his second term, Mr. Thaksin became increasingly dictatorial.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: In his second term, Mr. Thaksin became increasingly dictatorial.

Sentence.sentence: That was partly due to his talents: showmanship, strategic vision, an astonishing attention to detail and a dictatorial management style which many bosses must have envied.

means.word_mean: 独裁的, 独裁者的, 似独裁者的

sentences.en: For years the nation had been under the heel of a dictatorial regime.
sentences.cn: 多年来这个国家一直在独裁政权的铁蹄下。

means.word_mean: 爱发号施令的;霸道的, 专横的;盛气凌人的

sentences.en: At first he was most dictatorial and aggressive in what he said,but when he realised that he would get nowhere by that means,he began to sing another tune.
sentences.cn: 起初他的说法十分专横武断,但当他认识到这样做行不通的时候,他就开始改弦易辙了。
